name: Cycling Lisbon's Riverfront
description: Along the riverfront, you can see museums, historical sites, and interesting places to go. Lisbon's riverfront is a 24 km (15 miles) flat stretch of wide views over the city and the Tagus river, which is mostly covered by bike lanes. This triip is recommended to someone who is either visiting Lisbon for only a few hours or willing to spend half a day planning the rest of their stay. You will be able to have an overall view of everything that is worth a visit in the city and be advised according to your personal interests. Guided and coached by an experienced urban cyclist, you will also discover Lisbon's hidden secrets that only some locals know about. Rent a bike, bring your camera or a city map, and you will finish this trip with either an incredible collection of pictures of your short stay or with a detailed plan of places to go and things to visit.
